basics.name: Dao McGill
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an aspiring Software Engineer pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, graduating in December 2024. Passionate about building scalable systems and AI-driven solutions.

education.summary: Relevant coursework includes Algorithms, Data Networks, Data Structures, Operating Systems, and Software Engineering I & II.

work.company: John A. Burns School of Medicine
work.summary: Developed and tested software solutions for medical technology research.
highlights: Reduced training time for machine learning models by over 50% through optimized segmentation workflows using MONAILabel.
Automated analysis of 3D bone meshes, standardizing robusticity grading across datasets.
Collaborated with researchers to develop and deploy AI-driven models for surgical planning.
Configured and maintained Dockerized environments for secure and scalable operations.

projects.name: Open Source Contributions
projects.description: Contributed to Kaiaulu, an open-source project for scalable data retrieval and analysis.
highlights: Developed R and Python pipelines for large-scale data processing and parallel workflows.
Enhanced syntax extraction using srcML and XPath, supporting NLP-driven code analysis.
Documented processes through task-specific Jupyter notebooks, improving knowledge transfer.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Grant
awards.summary: Awarded grant for research in AI-driven biomedical technology.
